word: 13-15 (Matthew 27:42; Mark 15:31). Grief, Fear, and Wonder Mingled.--Those strong men were so burdened with grief that they wept as they traveled on. Christ's pitying heart of love saw here a sorrow which He could relieve. The disciples were reasoning with each other concerning the events of the past few days, and marveling how the fact of Jesus yielding Himself up to a shameful death could be reconciled with His claims as the Son of God.
